reviews.text: Although it is a nice little station, it is awful for Disabled Access, (London bound) and they don’t provide discounted parking for disabled blue badge holders, even though the only way to get on to the platform in a wheelchair is through the car park, which is quite a way around the back of the station. It is really disappointing. A lack of accessibility across most train stations, seems to be standard :(

Leicester been Market Harborough Station Platform 1 and 2 for London and Nottingham By Derby and Sheffield trip ticket prices great service we have station at Market Harborough both everyone that great new stations platforms

Was at the station this morning (13 July) just after 8am. There are temporary toilets outside as those on station platform closed. The temporary toilets are in a disgusting condition: dirty, no loo paper, and no water when taps turned on...

As the station is about to go under major improvements to increase the linespeed and accessibility, my review of the station applies to pre rebuilding. 

The station has a nice enough design with a ticket office, large car park and taxi drop off point. Step free access is only possible for trains to Leicester and facilities like toilets are only located on the Leicester bound platform too. Both platforms have seating and a waiting room, but the London bound platform is really short. Trains stop far from the entrance towards Leicester.
